intro: Diphorea, commonly known as the false mallow, is a genus of flowering plants belonging to the Malvaceae family. It comprises several species, primarily found in tropical and subtropical regions of Asia and Africa. The plants are characterized by their showy, often pink or purple flowers that bloom in clusters. They typically have heart-shaped leaves and produce capsule fruits containing small, smooth seeds. Diphorea species are often grown for their ornamental value due to their vibrant floral displays.
